Nigeria have appointed Eric Chelle as their new men’s head coach.

The Nigeria Football Federation (NFF) confirmed the appointment in a statement.

summary:
Monaco have agreed a deal with Sturm Graz for the signing of forward Mika Biereth.
Monaco are set to pay an initial fee of €13million (£10.8m, $13.4m) for the 21-year-old, with an additional €2m in potential add-ons.
Arsenal would also be due a percentage of the transfer fee as part of the sell-on clause they negotiated when Biereth moved from the club to Sturm Graz in the summer.
The Denmark youth international joined the Austrian top flight side for a club record £4m in July and has scored 14 goals in 25 appearances in all competitions this season.

title: Barcelona’s Inaki Pena dropped for Wojciech Szczesny over lateness – Hansi Flick - The Athletic
summary:
Hansi Flick has said goalkeeper Inaki Pena was dropped for Barcelona’s Supercopa de Espana semi final victory over Athletic Club because it was the third time he was late for a team meeting.
25-year-old Pena has established himself as Barca’s first-choice goalkeeper after Marc-Andre ter Stegen was ruled out for the rest of the season in September with a knee ligament injury.
Barca signed free agent Wojciech Szczesny following Ter Stegen’s injury, but Pena had played in 19 matches with the Catalan club planning on playing Szczesny during their Copa del Rey campaign.

title: Gael Monfils becomes oldest man to win ATP tennis title in history in Auckland - The Athletic
summary:
Gael Monfils has become the oldest player to win an ATP Tour title in history, overtaking Roger Federer’s record which had stood since 2019.
The Frenchman beat Zizou Bergs 6-3, 6-4 in Auckland to win the ASB Classic at 38 years, 4 months, and seven days old, recording his 13th tour singles title the day before the start of the 2025 Australian Open.

Manchester City are working on a deal to sign Palmeiras defender Vitor Reis.
The Premier League champions have an agreement in place with the player and are negotiating over a fee with the Brazilian club valuing the 18-year-old at upwards of £25million (€30.1m, $31m).
He is seen by City as a first-team signing but it remains to be seen whether, in the event an agreement is reached, he would arrive in January or later this year.

Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson is “fine” but the Premier League champions are still without defenders John Stones and Ruben Dias.

After last weekend’s 4-1 win over West Ham United, City host League Two Salford City in their FA Cup third-round tie on Saturday.

summary:
Manchester City are working on deals to sign Omar Marmoush and Abdukodir Khusanov this month.

The Pulse Newsletter 📣 | This is The Athletic’s daily sports newsletter. Sign up here to receive The Pulse directly in your inbox.

Good morning! Agree to terms today.


The legal tampering period of NFL free agency starts today at noon ET, which basically means teams can speak to prospective free agents but can’t officially agree to contracts yet (that part comes Wednesday). You’ll read about plenty of “agreements” today. 
It was supposed to be a frenzy, but judging by the events of the last week — highlighted by a bonkers day yesterday — it’s fair to wonder what...

summary:
Renato Veiga is likely to leave Chelsea this month with a number of clubs looking to sign the Portugal international.
Veiga is already being targeted by Borussia Dortmund, but face competition for his signature from teams in the Premier League, Italy and France.
Chelsea have set an asking price of up to £29million and will also request a sell-on clause to be included. They are not interested in loaning the 21-year-old out and are only prepared to sanction a permanent departure.

title: Leeds forward Joe Gelhardt finalising loan move to Hull - The Athletic
summary:
Joe Gelhardt is finalising a loan move from Leeds United to Hull City.
The 22-year-old striker has made just three league starts with the club since August 2022 and needs to jump-start his career.
Meanwhile, midfielder Charlie Crew is also finalising a loan away from Leeds, but to Doncaster Rovers in League Two.
Gelhardt is undergoing his medical today (Monday) and expects to conclude the formalities on a deal until the end of the season.
It will be his second loan stint in the Championship, having linked up with Sunderland in January 2023, where he made 20 appearances and scored three goals.

Tien won 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-7(8), 1-6, 7-6(10-7), in a match that lasted just shy of five hours. It ended just before 3 a.m., with one very familiar character and another playing the second five-set Grand Slam match of his career.

summary:
An expert at the European Union’s highest court has questioned whether Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) verdicts really should be the last word in sports rows, potentially overturning a system that has worked across sport since 1984.

summary:
Arsenal have confirmed Renee Slegers as their permanent head coach on a contract until the end of the 2025-26 season.
Slegers, 35, stepped up from her role as assistant coach to take interim charge following Jonas Eidevall’s resignation on October 15 and has since overseen 10 wins and one draw in her 11 matches in all competitions. She won the Women’s Super League (WSL) manager of the month for December.

summary:
Bundesliga club Holstein Kiel have been forced to defend their signing of USMNT international John Tolkin following criticism of his social media activity.
The 22-year-old wing-back — a club-record transfer from Major League Soccer side New York Red Bulls — has faced criticism for his activity online relating to a variety of topics including gender identity and conspiracies around the COVID pandemic.

title: Domenico Tedesco leaves position as Belgium head coach - The Athletic
summary:
Domenico Tedesco has left his position as Belgium head coach.
The 39-year-old was appointed in February 2023 and won 12 of his 24 matches at the helm, with the team eliminated by France in the round of 16 at Euro 2024.
The nation’s disappointing European Championships showing, in which they won just one of their four matches, has been followed by an underwhelming Nations League campaign.

Former Premier League midfielder Dele Alli has signed a deal with Italian side Como until 2026.
The deal contains an option to extend the contract for a further 12 months.
The Athletic reported that the Serie A side were open to letting the 28-year-old train with them as he continued his recovery from a long-term injury, which he has been doing since December.
A Como statement said the club “recognises his exceptional talent” but the focus was on “providing Dele with a supportive environment where he can gradually integrate into the squad.”

title: Florentino Perez re-elected Real Madrid president as four new board members added - The Athletic
summary:
Former Wolfsburg chairman Francisco Garcia Sanz has joined Real Madrid’s board in one of four new additions following president Florentino Perez’s re-election.
Perez was re-elected as Madrid president for a fifth successive term on Sunday after standing uncontested.
The club also confirmed the appointments of four new board members until 2029 following Sunday’s board meeting: Garcia Sanz, Manuel Redondo Sierra, Jose Angel Sanchez and Manuel Gomez Barrera.
Garcia Sanz was Wolfsburg chairman between 2009 and 2018 and had been on the Bundesliga club’s board since 2004.

title: Iga Swiatek: WADA will not appeal against world No 2’s doping ban - The Athletic
summary:
WADA, world sport’s anti-doping body, will not appeal against the one-month doping sanction levied against tennis world No 2 Iga Swiatek.
The Pole recorded a positive test for the banned substance trimetazidine (TMZ) in August. The International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA) subsequently announced a one-month suspension in November after ruling that the player’s level of fault was at the lowest end of the range for ‘No Significant Fault or Negligence’ and not intentional.
Swiatek served 22 days of the backdated ban from September to October and the remainder between November and...

summary:
Keylor Navas has joined Argentinean club Newell’s Old Boys.
The 38-year-old, formerly of Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain, has not played since leaving the French club at the end of the 2023-24 season.
The goalkeeper is best known for his five-year spell at Madrid between 2014 and 2019, where he made 162 appearances and won 11 senior trophies including three Champions League titles.
In 2019, he joined PSG — where he was first-choice until the arrival of Gianluigi Donnarumma in 2021.

title: Wilfried Zaha joins MLS club Charlotte FC from Galatasaray on loan - The Athletic
summary:
Wilfried Zaha has joined MLS club Charlotte FC on a year-long loan from Galatasaray.
The 32-year-old will play for Charlotte throughout the 2025 season with his contract at the U.S. club running through to January 17, 2026, with an option to extend the agreement until June 30, 2026.
The Athletic reported on January 16 that Zaha was in advanced talks to join Charlotte on loan.
The arrangement ends the Ivory Coast international’s loan spell at French side Lyon, whom Zaha joined in August last year but where he has only made six appearances in all competitions and started only one game.

title: Aryna Sabalenka avoids Australian Open upset against Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova - The Athletic
summary:
MELBOURNE, Australia — Aryna Sabalenka, the world No. 1 and two-time champion at the Australian Open, survived a major scare against Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova to advance to the semifinals.
Sabalenka was twice a break down in the deciding set, but recovered to claim a 6-2, 2-6, 6-3 victory and a 19th straight win at Melbourne Park. With both players winning just over 60 percent of their first-serve points for the match, it was second-serve points that made the difference. Sabalenka won that battle in the first and third sets; Pavlyuchenkova won it in the second.
She will play her good friend...

summary:
Manchester United supporters have called on the club to freeze ticket prices and “end the war on season ticket holders” in an open letter to Sir Jim Ratcliffe.
Ratcliffe, whose INEOS group owns a minority stake in the club and controls football operations, was at Craven Cottage for United’s victory at Fulham, but was subjected to chants from the away end as fans made their displeasure at the recent mid-season ticket price rises clear.

summary:
Real Betis have completed the signing of Antony on loan from Manchester United until the end of the season.
Betis will cover 84 per cent of Antony’s wages plus potential performance-related bonuses during the loan period. There is no option to make the move permanent nor is there an upfront loan fee included in the deal.
Antony becomes United’s first departure of the winter transfer window, while the club would reluctantly consider the sales of academy graduates Kobbie Mainoo and Alejandro Garnacho and Marcus Rashford is also available. United have, meanwhile, bid €30m for Lecce...

title: Wolves’ Vitor Pereira confident new signings will arrive before transfer window closes - The Athletic
summary:
Wolverhampton Wanderers head coach Vitor Pereira has claimed he is confident his side will land the signings he wants before the end of the transfer window and stay in the Premier League.
Pereira wants two more players before the February 3 transfer deadline with a midfielder and another defender his main priorities. Centre-back Emmanuel Agbadou arrived from Stade de Reims earlier this month and has made four appearances since.
“I’m very confident,” said Pereira told a news conference on Saturday. “I’m very, very confident. “They (new players) will come and we will stay.

summary:

The deal for Engel, a player Cincinnati have had a long-standing interest in, is set to include an option to make the move permanent.
The left-back has fallen down the pecking order at the Championship club after Ryan Giles was brought in on loan from Hull City on Thursday.
Engel, 26, has been limited to 12 appearances in all competitions for Middlesbrough during the 2024-25 campaign, with Neto Borges Michael Carrick’s first-choice left-back this season.

title: Middlesbrough confirm Morgan Whittaker signing from Plymouth - The Athletic
summary:
Middlesbrough have completed the signing of forward Morgan Whittaker from Plymouth Argyle.
The Athletic reported on Friday Plymouth had accepted a transfer bid in the region of £6million ($7.5m) from Middlesbrough for Whittaker, and the Championship side later confirmed his arrival.
He has signed a four-and-a-half-year deal which runs until 2029.
“We’re delighted to be able to bring Morgan into the club,” head coach Michael Carrick said. “There was a lot of interest in him, but it says a lot that he wanted to come here and be a part of things.”
The 24-year-old, who was close...

title: Manchester United make €30m Patrick Dorgu offer to Lecce - The Athletic
summary:
Manchester United have tabled a €30million (£25.3m; $31.4m) bid for Lecce wing-back Patrick Dorgu.
The Athletic reported on January 22 that the two clubs were €10m apart in negotiations for the Denmark international, who Lecce priced at €40m while United indicated a willingness to go to €30m.
United’s director of negotiations Matt Hargreaves met with Lecce sporting director Pantaleo Corvino in Milan.
Figures at United are hopeful that a deal will be agreed and if one is, Dorgu would become the first senior arrival at Old Trafford under head coach Ruben Amorim. The Portuguese has...

title: Arsenal working on deal to sign Sverre Nypan from Rosenborg - The Athletic
summary:
Arsenal are working on a deal to sign midfielder Sverre Nypan from Rosenborg.
Dialogue between the clubs and with the player’s representatives is advancing, as Arsenal try to land the 18-year-old Norway youth international.
However, a firm decision on his future has yet to be made and no agreements are in place — meaning the situation remains open.
Nypan is regarded as one of the best prospects in Europe, having made his Norwegian league debut in 2022 aged just 15. In May 2023, he became the youngest player to score in a League match for Rosenborg — just 16 years and 145 days old.

title: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha not for sale in January, says Vitor Pereira: ‘We need more players’ - The Athletic
summary:
Wolverhampton Wanderers head coach Vitor Pereira says Matheus Cunha is not for sale this month — and confirmed he wants two more signings before the transfer deadline.
Pereira says the club are working to add more players before the winter window closes on February 3, with another central defender and a midfielder believed to be the priorities.
He has also spoken to Cunha after criticising his body language during Monday’s 3-1 defeat to Chelsea and received assurances that the Brazil international is committed to Wolves.
And Pereira said that, while contracts and transfers are handled by...

title: Enzo Maresca says Chelsea do not need midfield signings despite Romeo Lavia injury - The Athletic
summary:
Enzo Maresca believes Chelsea do not need to sign another midfielder in this window despite Romeo Lavia being ruled out with injury for the third time this season.
Lavia sustained a muscular injury against Bournemouth last week and as reported by The Athletic, is going to be on the sidelines for weeks.
The 21-year-old has also had two spells out with hamstring problems this campaign and has yet to play a full 90 minutes since moving to Chelsea in the summer of 2023 from Southampton for an initial £53million. In 2023-24, he played just 32 minutes.
Renato Veiga, who can play in midfield, is...

title: West Ham negotiating to sign RB Leipzig striker Andre Silva on loan deal - The Athletic
summary:
West Ham United are in negotiations with RB Leipzig to sign Andre Silva on a loan deal with an option to buy.
The Portugal international striker has found himself down the pecking order at RB Leipzig and has not started a Bundesliga match this campaign.
The 29-year-old spent the 2023-24 season on loan at Real Sociedad, where he scored four goals in 26 appearances, and has previously played for Porto, Milan, Sevilla and Eintracht Frankfurt.
West Ham are currently without a fit recognised striker in the squad with Niclas Fullkrug currently sidelined for “a number of weeks” with a hamstring...

title: Mikel Arteta confirms Arsenal ‘actively’ looking to identify January transfers: ‘We are very short’ - The Athletic
summary:
Mikel Arteta has said that Arsenal are “actively” looking to identify targets in the January transfer window as he admits the side “ideally need some help”.
The Arsenal manager said his opinion on the situation was “clear” after losing Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Jesus to hamstring and anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injuries. Saka is expected to be out until at least March, while Jesus’ ACL will keep him out of action for around nine months.
Arteta was recently boosted by the return of Ethan Nwaneri, who returned from a muscular injury to play 32 minutes...

title: Sheffield United sign Tom Cannon from Leicester in £10m transfer - The Athletic
summary:
Leicester City striker Tom Cannon has joined Sheffield United in a £10million transfer.
The 22-year-old joined Leicester in a £7.5m move from Everton in the summer of 2023 but only made 16 appearances under Enzo Maresca, although he missed the first few months of the season after a fracture in his back was discovered during his medical.
The Republic of Ireland international was sent out on loan to Stoke City by Steve Cooper this season.
Cannon scored 11 goals in 25 appearances for Stoke and after Cooper departed, Cannon was recalled last week by new manager Ruud van Nistelrooy as several...

title: Juventus confirm signing of Randal Kolo Muani on loan from PSG - The Athletic
summary:
Juventus have confirmed the signing of Paris Saint-Germain forward Randal Kolo Muani on loan for the rest of the season.
The Athletic previously reported that Juventus, along with Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United were exploring loan deals for the France international.
A Juventus press release says the Italian club will pay an initial loan fee of €1million ($1.04m), which could increase by a further €2.6m and then another €2m from performance-related add-ons, while an option or obligation to buy Kolo Muani permanently is not included in the deal.

Ferguson is ruled out for the sixth match running by a left ankle injury for Everton’s visit to the Amex Stadium on Saturday. Brighton have one more game after that before the window shuts, away to Nottingham Forest on February 1.

title: Nottingham Forest defender Andrew Omobamidele set for Strasbourg transfer - The Athletic
summary:
Nottingham Forest defender Andrew Omobamidele is expected to complete a move to French club Strasbourg.
The centre-back will join the Ligue 1 side on loan, with options included in the deal to make the move permanent.
The move is not yet finalised but Omobamidele has travelled to France in order to complete the transfer.
Omobamidele had been of interest to a number of Championship clubs.
Omobamidele arrived in September 2023 as Forest rounded off a hectic transfer window with an £11million deal to sign him from Norwich City .

title: Ipswich complete loan signing of Brighton’s Julio Enciso - The Athletic
summary:
Ipswich Town have completed the signing of forward Julio Enciso on loan for the rest of the season.

The loan deal does not include an option to make the move permanent and Ipswich will cover Enciso’s wages in full.
The Paraguay international has been keen on a move away from the Amex Stadium in a bid to get more game time after being reduced to a bit-part role this campaign. 
He has made 16 appearances in all competitions this season with the...

title: Eric Garcia set to remain at Barcelona despite January interest - The Athletic
summary:
Eric Garcia is set to stay at Barcelona despite attracting interest from elsewhere in the January transfer window.
The Athletic reported in the DealSheet Garcia was on Barcelona’s list of potential departures and had been the subject of interest from Girona, Real Sociedad and Como.
The 24-year-old, who spent last season on loan at Girona, came off the bench on Tuesday to score an 86th-minute equaliser as Barcelona came from 4-2 down to beat Benfica 5-4 in the Champions League.
Club sources, who spoke to The Athletic on the condition of anonymity, said head coach Hansi Flick told Garcia...

title: Juventus verbally agree Renato Veiga loan deal with Chelsea - The Athletic
summary:
Chelsea have verbally agreed a deal to send Renato Veiga on loan to Juventus.
The Serie A side will pay a loan fee of €5million ($5.21m) with a possible €1m due in bonuses. There is no buy option in the agreement and Veiga will return to Chelsea ahead of the Club World Cup, which begins in mid-June.
The Athletic reported on January 21 that Chelsea would be willing to send Veiga out on loan if playing and economic conditions were met with Marseille and Borussia Dortmund among the interested clubs.
The 21-year-old has played 18 games for Chelsea but has started just one Premier League match...

title: Ange Postecoglou says Tottenham may not make further signings despite injury situation - The Athletic
summary:
Tottenham Hotspur head coach Ange Postecoglou has said that it remains a possibility that there are no further signings at the club this month.
Spurs completed the transfer of 21-year-old goalkeeper Antonin Kinksy from Slavia Prague on January 5 but have not made any more additions to the squad since then.
Postecoglou’s side take on German side Hoffenheim in their seventh league-phase game of the Europa League on Thursday and are set to be without 14 players as they make the trip to Germany.
When asked if there was a chance that Tottenham would not not sign anybody else this window,...

title: Manchester City complete Omar Marmoush signing from Eintracht Frankfurt - The Athletic
summary:
Manchester City have completed the signing of Omar Marmoush from German side Eintracht Frankfurt.
City have paid their Bundesliga counterparts a fee in the region of €70million (£59m) to €75m (£63m) plus bonuses.
The Egypt international has signed a four-and-a-half-year deal at the Etihad Stadium through to June 2029.
He becomes City’s third January signing following the arrivals of Abdukodir Khusanov from Lens and Vitor Reis from Brazilian side Palmeiras.
Marmoush, who will wear the number seven shirt for City, said he was joining “one of the best teams in the world”.

title: Brentford confirm new Mikkel Damsgaard contract - The Athletic
summary:

The defensive midfielder spent two-and-a-half seasons at Heidenheim and was part of the side that won promotion to the top flight of German football at the end of the 2022-23 campaign.
Maloney represented Germany at youth level before switching allegiances to the United States in 2018.

The 20-year-old has made 12 appearances for the Serie A side in all competitions this season.
Kayode has represented Italy at youth-team level and scored the winner against Portugal in the final of the Under-19 European Championship in 2023.

title: Aston Villa confirm signing of right-back Andres Garcia from Levante - The Athletic
summary:
Aston Villa have completed the transfer of right-back Andres Garcia from Spanish side Levante.
The Athletic reported on January 17 that the two clubs had reached an agreement on a fee of €7million (£5.91m; $7.2m) for the 21-year-old.
A new right-back was viewed as a priority by manager Unai Emery, with Celta Vigo’s Oscar Mingueza, Andrei Ratiu from Rayo Vallecano and Flamengo’s Wesley Franca among those considered.

title: Luis de la Fuente extends Spain contract until Euro 2028 - The Athletic
summary:
Luis de la Fuente has agreed a new contract with the Spanish men’s national team through to the end of Euro 2028.

De la Fuente’s existing deal with the RFEF (Spanish Football Federation) had been due to expire after the 2026 World Cup, with the 63-year-old last signing a contract extension in February 2024.
That came a few months before Spain won the European Championship under De la Fuente in Germany, their first major title since Euro 2012.

Aston Villa have reached an agreement with Emiliano Buendia over a one-year contract extension.
The Argentinian midfielder, 28, joined Villa from Norwich City in 2021 for more than £30million and his existing terms were scheduled to expire in June 2026.
The revised deal — which is yet to be signed — are now set to run for a further 12 months.
Buendia has played a limited role since returning last September from a knee injury, but impressed in Tuesday’s Champions League group-stage defeat at Monaco.

summary:
West Ham United have won a legal battle with their landlords at the London Stadium over a disputed payment linked to Czech billionaire Daniel Kretinsky’s 2021 purchase of a 27 per cent stake in the Premier League club.
Under the terms of the 2013 rental agreement for the former Olympic venue between WH Holding Ltd, the club’s parent company, and E20 Stadium LLP, a subsidiary of the publicly-funded London Legacy Development Corporation (LLDC), West Ham’s owners had to pay E20 a share of any profit they made on selling shares in the club for 10 years.

title: Chelsea’s Renato Veiga completes Juventus loan move - The Athletic
summary:
Juventus have completed the signing of Renato Veiga on loan from Chelsea until the end of the season.
The Athletic reported on January 23 that the clubs had verbally agreed a €5million ($5.21m) deal which would see Veiga spend the second half of the campaign in Italy. Chelsea may also be due up to €1m in potential add-ons.
Veiga becomes Juventus’ second loan signing of the window after Randal Kolo Muani’s arrival from Paris Saint-Germain.

Wolverhampton Wanderers are in discussions with Ajax about the possibility of an early end to Carlos Forbs’ loan spell at Molineux.
The 20-year-old winger signed for Wolves on loan in the summer with an obligation to buy for £11million this summer if he played a certain number of games.
Forbs has failed to hit that number, making just one start and nine appearances overall in the Premier League, amassing just 237 minutes of league action.
Now Ajax are hoping to take him back to Amsterdam to help solve their own transfer problems, with the club in need of extra options in wide positions.

Sage, 45, was sacked by Lyon after a run of five matches without a win in all competitions, culminating in a 1-1 league draw against Nantes on January 26.
Lyon are sixth in Ligue 1, 17 points behind league leaders Paris Saint-Germain but just four points off Monaco, who occupy the third and final Champions League qualification spot.

The Pulse Newsletter 📣 | This is The Athletic’s daily sports newsletter. Sign up here to receive The Pulse directly in your inbox.

Good morning! Giants fans, let’s ride.


We arrive at the one day this week where no NCAA Tournament games are on your television and, thus, it is time to talk about baseball. Because tomorrow, at 3 p.m. ET, Opening Day — also one of the best days of the sports calendar — begins. Let us rejoice. 
Trying to actually predict a baseball season is pure folly. It is a six-month, 162-game journey in which stars can rise and fall in a month’s time.

title: Manchester United reach broad agreement to sign Patrick Dorgu from Lecce - The Athletic
summary:
Manchester United have reached a broad agreement with Lecce for the transfer of Patrick Dorgu for €30million (£25.2m) plus €5m (£4.2m) in add-ons.
The Serie A side had been holding out for €40m (£33.6m) but negotiations have brought the figure to below United’s aim of a total £30m package with the add-ons a split of both simple bonuses and others that are more difficult to achieve.
The deal is not yet fully finalised, with finer details still to be decided, but there is now a clear sense on both sides that Dorgu will become a United player.

title: Arsenal win appeal against Myles Lewis-Skelly’s red card during Wolves victory - The Athletic
summary:
Arsenal have won their appeal against the red card issued to Myles Lewis-Skelly during their 1-0 victory over Wolverhampton Wanderers on Saturday.
The Athletic reported earlier on Tuesday that Arsenal would appeal the decision and the FA announced later in the day that an independent regulatory commission had upheld the challenge. That means Lewis-Skelly has avoided a three-match ban he would have otherwise received for ‘serious foul play’.
